review: Fast & casual family burger joint! Always a winner ! Went out on a limb this time and created my own burg. The ciabatta roll is pricey but saves you 70 calories and really fancies up a classic burg. I also added a fried egg-cooked perfect. I forgot to order my burg pink-my own fault-but still it came out super juicy for a no-pink patty! Donte was out waiter and did a great job keeping up the bottomless sweet tater fries (not pictured because consumed too quickly!) lost a star for price. Having to pay extra for every single little substitute (bun, egg, sauce, sweet taters) is obnoxious.
Horrible service. Rude staff. Long waits. Will never go back to this location. No such thing as bottomless fries or service after your meal comes after a long wait.

Walk in on a Saturday night not very busy at all after shopping at the mall. Where do I begin....service was horrible, manager horrible! My mom said straight to the manger when checking on us "You suck, your kitchen sucks" The manger said I quote so very rudely "So I suck?" My mother "Yup." As manager if you don't have any integrity when why are you still working as a manager. Okay let me tell you horrible bathrooms,horrible manager took criticism personally he just didn't care,server was pretty good, food was okay not horrible but not the best. It's sad you can't even go to a nice bathroom there was paper towels on the floor and toilet paper everywhere. Food my bun was soggy I had the Chicken Bruschetta Sandwich it had three spoon fulls of onions to many way to many onions. Well overall it sucked very disappointed makes Mc.Donalds look like a decent place to eat spend you money else where.

I wish I had walked into the restroom before eating here as it looked like the floor was littered with mouse droppings. We'll be calling the health inspector for sure. And aside from that very serious issue, the food was pretty bad and the service definitely wasn't great.
Gone way downhill!  Much smaller portions, plates come out looking very unappetizing, fries soggy and underdone...

Came here on a Saturday nite to celebrate my husband's birthday with our daughter and grand boys. The waiter got our food and drink orders correct but we ended up waiting almost a half hour for them to bring the birthday sundae and sing. Very disappointing.

Always Fresh and Hot We always enjoy eating here.  We came on a Saturday about 5:00 and it was already busy!  We had about a 5 min wait for a table for 2.  We both had burgers and fries and they were delicious as always.  I didn't give them a 5 because this visit the wait was longer for our food.  We appreciated the manager apologizing for the delay.  Will return again!
Horrible! No one answers the telephone, no value of the customer. No staff present. Not sure this RR will remain in business

Had a horrible experience when I came for lunch. The fries were hardly bottomless. While it too over 30 minutes to get our food we asked for more fries & our server sighed & rolled her eyes. The service was terrible, the attitudes of the staff were just unbelievable & the burgers sub par. We never returned. That was a year ago. I coach basketball & the team wanted to have our end of season gathering at RR so I figured I'd give it a second try. I called a day ahead and asked if I could reserve an area for 30 people and was told flat out NO. The man on the phone said we could come in and would all be seated in different tables first come first serve!! Obviously nothing has changed!!

The gourmet burger idea drew us in. The place is always busy so thought we would give it a try. We were lucky enough to be seated right away. The good stopped there. We were served our appetizer minus any napkins or utensils.  Had to flag our waiter down and ask for some. Ordered two burgers. And waited. And waited. And waited. The waiter came back once to take our appetizer plates and never returned.  We waited over forty minutes without ANYONE checking on us. Finally walked out.  They were not even busy. If I could give zero stars I would.

Sooo.....   where to begin....  5 minutes to be seated.  No not a wait.  Just 5 minutes to see someone to be seated.  Got table.  Sitting.   No server.  No hello.  No drinks.  Nothing.   Been here for 15 minutes.   At least 3 other tables with no service.   Not even busy.  Place is a shit hole.  Dont let the decor fool you, I wouldn't even let a dog eat here.  And in terms of service McDonald's would be considered far higher class.  Ate here before and was disappointed.   Gave it a second try.  Somehow they managed to make "bad" even worse.  Save yourself the disappointment and go to the much higher class taco bell across the street.

Not a good sign when, on arrival, you (and your fellow diners) grip the booth and surrounding chairs to avoid slipping on the greasy tile floor.  My ever-observant wife noticed the intersection where the wall meets the floor was shiny and the lower wall was discolored from what looked suspiciously like mold.  We arrived. We were seated and ready to order.  No problem with the drinks & we then placed our order.  Then the wait.  At this time you would think the wait staff would provide our silverware and napkins... an oversight, it happens.  We wait.  The observant-one sees that one of our gluten-free burgers is sitting out, waiting for our server to deliver.  We wait.  My wife's tension rises, and when that happens, tension ions are flying like crazy - even a neanderthal like me notices.  We wait.  We call the waiter over and he confirms that, yes, our one burger is sitting (5 minutes now), because they can't find a gluten- free bun for the other burger.  He will see what's up....we wait.  He returns and apologizes.  My wife instructs him to serve the complete meal and the other burger, bun-less.  He brings half the order.  We wait.  His manager brings the other half and apologizes. We have to remind our server that we still have no silverware and napkins.  We wait.  Finally, with utensils we commence to dine.  Food:  Burgers too cool and old, shiny cole-slaw and a salad that was was just fine (whatever). After waiting for just about everything during our meal, we did not wait to pay - thanks to the neat electronic pay box at our table.  We steeled ourselves to slide out without falling.  Admittedly, Red Robin is not the restaurant for us, we should have known better.

The food took forever and was luke-warm when we got it. I thought it was expensive for the small portions.  "Bottomless fries"? Over the course of the meal He dropped off 2 tiny plates with about 10 fries each. Hardly "Bottomless" They didn't wear hair nets in the kitchen and one girl working had long hair down to her butt flying all over as she moved around. One other lady was playing in her hair before taking food off the counter to serve. You are better off going somewhere else. Oh ya, best part...they had "Beast" on tap for a beer selection. I didn't even know that was possible. Not that anyone drinks it but you can get a case of it for what they were asking for a glass. LOL

The server was ok but ever since they put those machines on the table, service has gone downhill corporate wide. The food was a disgrace. The Mac and Cheese my kids got looked like it had sit in the heating window for 15-20 minutes.  I ordered the Signature Smoke and Pepper. That signature must have been in crayon and done by a 4 year old. Ive had this before and it had never looked like this. The cheese was almost melted off of the burger. Like it was put on the meat 2 minutes before going on the bun. And the bacon looked nothing like real bacon. It was microwaved bacon with a sorry attempt for peppercorn crackles. The fries were old and when I asked for my free refill I received only 6 fries (my kid thought it was funny that he could count them).  And by the time I saw my server again my kids were ready to go home.  Needless to say we're going to avoid this one in the chain for a while.

Food-3.5 Service-2 Restaurant-4 Not too bad. My mom and I came in for lunch on a Saturday. The place was crazy with kids, but because we are both over 21, we got seated in the bar area. The restaurant is clean, and I like that you don't have to sit in an area with screaming kids if you don't want to. We ordered the onion rig mini tower for $4...definitely worth it. The sauces they come with are good. My mom and I both ordered the Tavern Double burgers. Food was good, the fires were hot.  The only downside to the experience was the waiter. He seemed like he'd much rather be doing something else on a Saturday. Inattentive, and rude. Then had the nerve to tell us to rate him "Excellent" on the customer survey at the end. haha no.
The management of the hostess stand is garbage. We have been waiting 50 minutes while table after table after table of people were seated before us. Less than stellar.

I have received a Red Robin Loyalty Reward for a free burger on my birthday (3/17). On March 26, I have decided to phone in my order and picked it up at the RR by the FSK Mall.  When I got to the restaurant, the lobby where the hostess was standing behind the podium had a really funny smell. After I told the hostess that I was going to be picking up my food, she told me to sit at the bar and the bartender will get my food for me. No problem. I sat by the bar and watched some college basketball. The atmosphere of the restaurant was okay, but the smell from the lobby was approaching its way into the dining area. The restaurant was full, as it was the evening and it was Easter eve. Also, the bar was very clean, free of dirty plates and glasses.  When my food was ready, the bartender gave me my food which was neatly placed in the box with some fries. The gourmet burger I ordered was the Whiskey River BBQ Burger. I ordered that particular burger because I really wasn't feeling the other burgers that were on the menu via RR's website. As far as the fries, I felt that if I redeemed a free burger for my birthday, then I should've gotten at least 2 or 3 handfuls of fries. As far as the burger, it tasted good, except that I had to scrape the shredded lettuce because it looked and tasted soggy and I did not get a tomato in my burger. Overall, this place gets 4 stars for a nice interior, including the bar but 2 stars for the smell of the restaurant, soggy lettuce and no tomato. However, I will come back.

Good burger and fries.  The service was attentive and friendly.  The restaurant appeared clean and well managed.  The large number of diners indicated that the food and service are very good.  I would recommend this establishment.

Resturaunt was half empty and they still made us wait 15 minutes for a table on a Saturday at 430pm. Hostess was not very forthcoming or helpful. The burger came out cold and dry and was barely edible. Worst experience yet here, though they have been steadily declining in both service and quality.

We returned at urging of management to give them another try. We found service much better this time. Travis was our server. He was friendly and attentive. Food and drinks arrived promptly. Food was good. My husband and boys loved their burgers. I had a salad and enjoyed it. Glad to see management has made changes for the better! Horrible service. Our waitress was nice enough and trying but they were short staffed in the kitchen. So management sent her to the kitchen. So we never could get anything we needed. Plus saw at least 3 managers walking around but none offered any assistance. In our section a man at another table even stood up and yelled "can we please get some service". A manager looked at him and then walked away. I don't fault our server at all, this is a clear failure of management. If you need to put a server on the cook line, assign her tables to someone else. Don't just leave customers with no server.  The food is barely mediocre. My chili cheese fries were burned and the chili tastes like dog food.  Won't be coming back until their Yelp reviews improve indicating they are getting their act together. Used to be a decent place to go, but based on the other reviews and our experience they have gone way down hill.

Went in today to grab an early dinner to go was told by hostess to go to the bar and place an order with amber. So I walk over to the bar. Bartender has her back to me so I walk around to her side. I said excuse me I would like to place an order to go. She rudely snaps "the other side of the bar" while giving me a dirty look. I walk over to the other side, she finishes what she is doing, starts to come over to my side and at this point another person stood next to me to order. The phone rings and with no acknowledgment from the bartender, she turns her back to us and takes a phone order. I left and would never go back.

1st time in RR... Gourmet burger and brewery.  Not too bad at all.  We sat at the bar top no wait at all.  The burger we order was the red robin special turned out great even with no cheese.  On top of that they have sweet potato fries :).  The dipping sauce options... Bomb!!! The drinks option is there too.  Service is great the iPad on the table made it very convenient to order appetizers and pay too... Over all great experience ;)
Disappointed again.  Used to be good food, reasonable prices, fast service.  Not so much anymore.

I don't mind a wait. They give you an app that tells you what place you are in line. Problem, when 8 groups of 5 or LARGER get seated before a table for 2. Then FOUR groups of 2 that came AFTER me and showed on app as coming AFTER got seated. Each time I went to Hostess she locked up and couldn't explain. The last couple asked why they were being seated before me and my 8yr old daughter. No response. I asked for Manager and then magically got seated. I asked to still speak to Mgr but that never happened.
Amber snapped at me and was completely rude for my entire visit. I consistently felt like an inconvenience to her and will not be returning as long as she is a waitress here

4.5 stars, for fantastic customer service!  Kudos to Kristen, the manager at this location. From the moment I stepped in the door, she  was super helpful. Her hostess was swamped, so she stepped right in to seat me.  I ordered a Western BBQ burger with sweet potato fries and a Freckled (strawberry) lemonade. I noticed the burger was taking a little while, but I didn't think much of it. A minute or two later, it arrived. It was huge! Really tasty too... a little to much "char" on the edges for a medium-well burger, but still very good. Wouldn't go as far as calling it "gourmet", but it was a satisfying lunch.   My sweet potato fries were limp and cold, but before I could finish my first fry, the manager showed up to my table with a fresh, piping hot basket of sweet potato fries. She explained that she accidentally sold my burger, and that they had to make me a new one, which explained the wait. She said she also "didn't like how my fries looked" on my plate, so she took the initiative to bring me some fresh ones. She really didn't have to do that and I was really impressed at her level of attention to detail. This was my first visit to a Red Robin restaurant, but it will definitely not be my last.
Avocabo salad is all I really have to say. Always call it in and always ready when I'm there I am one full happy customer :)

First and last time I visit this Red Robin. It was beyond gross!! The burgers were over cooked and on stale hard buns. The meatballs my daughter had were hard as rocks and they didn't charge us for them and let us order something else but that was just as bad!! The overpriced freckled lemonade was the only thing that tasted good... so so disappointed

First time at this place and was not impressed. For starters a place which is advertising as a gourmet burger joint and only two cooking options. Pink or no pink. Sad. Really sad. I like my burgers med rare at most and was not an option. Servers where milling about doing nothing. Got father in laws order wrong. How hard is a hamburger with just mustard and onion?  Had cheese and lettuce and tomato. When asked to fix it they did but had another one out within 4o seconds. Fresh made, probably not. Final straw was the fact that the servers don't even take payment. Pay on tablet left at table. I though it was a full service restaurant but no, overpriced fast food

We've eaten in at RR and it's okay, but we will never get carry out there again.  I ordered a gluten free dairy free meal for my daughter, she repeated it back to me, but what I took home was a regular burger with cheese.  I called them as soon as I noticed, and they offered to make a new one, but nothing for the hassle and extra half hour I spent driving back and forth again.  That is not what I call good customer service.  :-P Went back for dine-in, and the food was good, service was good, but I'm waiting for my food and asked if they have wifi.  Nope.  Seriously?  There are places I can eat for $2 that have wifi.  Get with this century.  Also tried to order one of my favorite beverages, Captain and ginger ale, but they have no ginger ale.  *sigh*

First time at this Red Robin. Service was not too quick. Wanted my burger (Smoke and Spice, which was overpriced) cooked Medium. Took forever and came out to me with no pink whatsoever. Sweet potato fries were the saltiest I've ever had. Will go elsewhere next time for a burger.

Our appetizers came out but no plates or serving spoons. We pushed the "call server" button but she never showed up. I had to ask the hostess to bring us plates. My soup came out all over my plate and wrap - soupy mess. Our server forgot items every time she did arrive at our table. Lastly, Red Robin pulls the switcharoo with kids drinks.  Two of their kids drinks are not bottomless but it's written on the menu in an ambiguous manner as every other specialty drink is bottomless (all but two of eight). Food takes forever and drink refills are impossible to get while you're still in need of them. In two months, I've been here three times, with the same experience. I think I'm going to pass on this particular Red Robin in the future.

I have been a loyal customer to this location for the last 2 years. I am celiac and they have been wonderful. This time our server was wonderful. We sat in bar area. A booth in the corner. Our food came and was lukewarm. As I looked behind my sister the booth area was full of dried food and cob webs and dirt/grime and dust. My other sister ordered more broccoli and it was delivered on a dirty plate. Spoke to a "new" manager, whom delivered the dirty broccoli. He was ridiculous and unhelpful. Deer in the headlight look. No compensation was offered. We won't be going back. Eater beware, dirty dining..

I love love love this restaurant because it's a perfect family time. It's get really busy if you come on lunch or dinner time. I always go a hour or two after lunch time. Same at dinner time. Mostly I always get seat in every time I go there with my family without any waiting time. The host and waiter/waitress are always nice, friendly, does give you everything you requested, and always on time. The restaurant is always clean and I love their restroom that has a sink for small children and does have baby changer. Thanks goodness. I like how they have separate rooms for family, the other for a couple with no kids or older kid that doesn't make noise or cry , and the bar area for anyone with a group or couple without kids. Over all this is a perfect place for get together with family. Always red robin at least twice a month.

Got extremely sick from the food..  Ordered a burger and within a few hours I was throwing up and had terrible stomach pains.  I could not stop vomiting.  Went to the doctors the next morning after no sleep to find out it was food poisoning.  Well never return to this Red Robin again.  Service was terrible as well (long time waiting for our food).

Why or how is this place still in business ??  The "gourmet" burgers are gross..  The service SUCKS .. The management may possibly be even WORSE . The bottomless fries aren't worth going for .. Huge chunks of fried potato that have no flavor .. Can't get carryout orders correct . Is it seriously THAT hard to LISTEN, write something down, & make sure it's done ? I suppose it is.. Some people aren't cut out to be servers (not enough common sense)  Save yourself the time and money.. go across the street to smash burger for a much cheaper meal, Less of a wait & MUCH better food !!
Bartender didn't know how to make a White Russian. It still tasted good. Had to ask for water. Salad took forever to come out and the presentation was sloppy. But it was delicious.

Took 45 minutes to get our food and the manager came out to apologize at 35 minutes said he would bring some fries.  Well he never returned and food showed up a little bit at a time.   We have two kids under 7 and they were extremely grumpy by the time we got our food.  As always the food was good but there service is lacking at best.  We ordered some milk shakes that took 20 minutes for them to come.  If you have a couple hours to waste stop by and enjoy a great burger.

"Gourmet burgers and brews" should be changed to "cool burger with hard buns, bad drinks and terrible service."  When we arrived no one was at the hostess podium to greet us and we were left awkwardly waiting. Once seated the waiter was both unhelpful and had little knowldge of the "gourmet brews." We placed our drink orders to have him correct us on how to pronounce jim beam, "what? You mean a drink of beam?" The drinks were poorly made, and he forgot our soda and had to be reminded twice.  We place our food orders, and begin the wait. As we wait we did have entertainment though, 3 employees were eating at the food preparation area, 4 employees were on their cell phones, and the bar tender was drinking from a soda cup behind the bar. The apps and the main course were brought at the same time, the food was cool, and the burgers were flavorless.  Now dont get me wrong, when the food is good at red robins it is great, but it's like restaurant Russian roulette at this location.

Red Robin is great, but the only thing that's bad is the service. They take a long time to give us the food and we don't order too much.  I sure do like their deserts.  The best one is the flaky doughnuts and the dips, but they should try to be faster at serving the food. I still like this place and it's burgers.

I must say, Red Robin is definitely living up to its hype.  I walked in expecting it to be slightly dirty and full of greasy men chugging beer...but it was the exact opposite. The crowd was a mix of families, friends, and older people enjoying some delicious food while watching the huge TV. A young friendly host brought us to our table and it only took a minute for the waiter to arrive. Extra points.  After looking at the menu for about 15 minutes (the abundance of options made a selection very difficult), I settled on the guacamole bacon burger. Now, let me point out that its a general rule to never mix meat on a burger. I think it's strange and takes away from the entire burger-eating experience.  Thank goodness I broke that rule.  The guacamole bacon burger comes with a grid of bacon (yes, grid) that's perfectly cooked over as many patties as you'd like. I chose "no pink" because in the event that  meat does enter my mouth...it shouldn't be moo-ing.  It was love at first bite. All the toppings (lettuce, tomato, onion, and guac) blended together perfectly. The crispy fries were a perfect compliment to the burger, especially after I sprinkled their special seasoning and ketchup all over it.  My only complaint? That I didn't ask for it on a whole grain bun.  They also have a variety of salads and wraps for "healthier" choices. All in all it was a pleasant experience and if you're in the area a visit is recommended :)

They started separating parties with kids to one part of the restaurant away from other guests. This is ok unless you get there early when all of the families are waiting. We saw multiple parties without kids that got there well after us get seated before us at open tables that they "couldn't sit us at because that 1/2 of the restaurant doesn't allow kids." Horrible move for a restaurant that tries to be (and previously was) family friendly. Also the last time we were there we didn't even get out drinks until after our food came even though we asked multiple times. Poor service, food is good.
Customer service is horrible from the top to the bottom in this case.. contacted corporate and got no response...
I heard their burgers are frozen and pushed thru a mass conveyor belt.  Food is t that good and the service is terrible.  Go to Applebee's on Monday for 6.99 burgers and save yourself the stress.

Gormet burgers?! How can you call yourself a gormet burger place when you get your meat frozen and will not/can not cook it to proper temp. This place will only cook med well or well done (aka dry and technically wrong) because they know their meat is not fresh and are worried it will make people sick. Ummm RED FLAG!! There are WAY to many places out there that grind their own meat fresh daily and cook it any way you choose (Like Madrones down the street), that places LIKE RR should be embarrassed and shut down! Frozen patties at a "Gormet Burger" place?!?! Give me a break! Yick

Six months ago my son and I went there and the service was terrible. Tried it again and still poor service.  After waiting several minutes trying to get our waitresses attention we turned on the service light on the table and still waited 8 or 9 minutes for someone to come by and at least half of the tables were empty.
Food was ok service sucked just waited ten mins for a box for half my burger...a BOX not going back not worth it so many better options around here
Over priced.. The hamburgers taste like frozen patties. Slow service on refills. My son got their cod fish and it was tasteless. Probably won't go there again

Terrible terribly rude service. Don't you dare sit at a booth table near the bar with your kid to wait (40 plus minutes) for your to go order unless you want to be told to stand in the doorway by a 20 something power tripping staff member. P.S no alcohol was ordered and we did not sit at the bar. There are so many great burger places in Frederick you should definitely skip this one!

I have visited this location 3 times now.  It seems like the worst service ever.  They never seem prepared.  I watched the manager sit at a table while it was obvious the servers with in the weeds.  The food is always good, but I won't be going back due to service.

Although I have lots to complain about for this location, I'll keep it as short as possible with one piece of advice: never come here within the last hour of operation: Me and my lady walked in around 9pm sharp on a weekday where they close at 10. Nobody at the host stand. Weren't approached until 5 minutes later. But prior to finally being approached, I saw management and other employees from a distance see us standing there and didn't let anybody know nor come up and approach us. The place had about 5-7 tables sitting down and there was only one server on. Never saw any other employee help him out or take a table for him. Looked like an every man for himself deal.  Got approached 10 minutes after sitting down since the server was overloaded with tables. Our servers name was Matt Cluckey or something like that. Thank god for this guy cuz he made everything better. Took care of us and made up for everything.  Final thought- for all those that didn't acknowledge us when we walked in, don't make me feel uncomfortable coming in during the last hour of operation. Your open. I'm a paying guest. Don't treat me like I came in 15 minutes to closing. And I heard from across the restaurant that our server had to remind the kitchen that they're still open and that there was food to be cooked. They were clearly too focused on cleaning and getting out of there. This place is a wreck and I feel bad for our server. He should find a better serving job at a better establishment. If I am to come back, it'd be because of our server.

Sitting at the bar making myself scarce while my girls are eating with all the cast and crew from their highschool play. I'm in awe of the bartender, Gabriella... She is cranking out one milkshake after another.  Apparently every kid in the place ordered one.  I think I better tip her big, since she's only gonna get a small cut of the servers' tips, but she's really busting her ass!!!  I might even write a letter to corporate and/or have a word with her manager. She deserves a big pat on the back!
Good service, clean restaurant, food is lacking. Bland... I must have the wrong definition of gourmet.

The food is still good, but they changed certain things that were good about it. They changed back from the easy going relaxed upgrade to a more child friendly atmosphere. It felt like more of a Chucky Cheese with kids running around. It lost the Friday's or Chili's vibe which is where it seemed to wanted to be going in too. They took away the Happy Hour after 8 pm which is a small perk when get off late from work and wanting to have a reasonable priced beer and watch the end of a sports game. They cut back on the selection of alcohol to a bare minimum. I am fine with the changes if they would just choose what direction they want to go. Only other change which seems to be the norm is that all apps and drinks are ordered on the touch pads. This seems to slow down the service since the designated person to the table does not care about a tip or service. They basically are a food walker. I know that has to suck and sort of understand. What is so wrong with interaction anymore. Still it is hard to beat the burgers.

Newly opened Red Robin restaurant in Frederick.  After being open 2+ months, this was my first visit, and there was a bit of a wait.  I always got the impression from the commercials that Red Robin was a fast food restaurant but apparently this is not so! I had the caprese chicken sandwich and (drrrooooollll) it was GOOD.  Service was crazy busy so it took a while to get our food but it was all good.  I know it's a chain restaurant, which I don't really usually review (the FTR was too tempting) but it was yummy and now I know I'm a fan!

I recently went to red robin for the first time about 3 weeks ago. I had received a gift card for a gift and decided if give it a try. I went around 8pm with my boyfriend and we both ordered burgers of course and had the onion rings for an app. I must say the app was the best part of our experience. The service wasn't very good and our food was only slightly warm and it took over 25 mins to reach the table. I most likely will not return to this eatablishment.

Excellent service from Gabriella. The black angus, southern charm burger was excellent. The establishment was clean and I did not feel rushed. Fun place to eat by yourself or with others. Highly recommend as a fast food, sit down restaurant.
Good food & great service... I would like to visit again. Their burgers are delish and onion rings are the best.
My child chooses Red Robin when asked where he wants to eat. Good food, good service ! Thanks guys !
Good food. Would have received another star if the hostess would not have made it a point to correct us for seating ourselves. Waited at the hostess stand for awhile and sat down in the bar area.

I cannot speak to the food at this location, because we never got that far. After waiting over 40 minutes for our food, we finally gave up and left. It was a Tuesday at lunch time and there seemed to be plenty of wait staff and kitchen help - but they couldn't get a burger cooked in 40+ minutes.
CAMPFIRE SAUCE. THAT IS ALL. Seriously, the food here is always good. Service has been great every time as well. My only gripe is the lack of a waiting room.

I'll keep it short and to the point. Ordered the cheeseburger with a turkey patty and a pizza kids meal. Pizza was pretty tasty. Turkey burger patty more like a plastic compilation of meat-like things. Pretty rubbery and weird feeling. Fries are bottomless, but weren't hot so didn't see the joy in refilling. Should have went to Chik-fil-A across the street. Smh

I wanted to give this particular joint 5 stars so bad, but it took 40 minutes to receive our food.  It wasn't even crowded (Wednesday night), and it seems like there were a fair amount of servers.  The waiter was very friendly and gave us steak fries and refilled our drinks while we waited.  My husband really liked his gourmet cheeseburger and I ordered a BLTA Croissant which was delicious.  I will be going back, but I hope I don't have to wait forever for my meal again.

My fiancé and I went into this with low expectations. We are dining divas and usually avoid chain restaurants, but we love burgers! We decided to give Red Robin a try. Fast friendly service, good happy hour prices ($2.50 domestic drafts and house wine), and the burgers were very tasty! I ordered the bacon guacamole and he got the royal robin and we both were happy. The fact that you can get bottomless fries is pretty cool too! If you're being healthy, you can also get bottomless broccoli. You can also get a lettuce wrap instead of a bun as well.  The decor and restaurant is corny as a whole, but who cares if the food is decent. My fiance's only complaint was that the meat could've been thicker (where's the beef?!!)

Avoid this place like the plague! Service is terrible and they aren't even busy and fully staffed! Can't really say how good or bad the food is, I paid for my drinks after they screwed up my order of fries that I waited 25 minutes for. It took the waiter 10 minutes to get to the table and another 10 minutes to bring drinks and take the fry order. I most definitely will not be returning here even if it were free.

Overpriced crap food who 9 times out of 10 gets your order wrong.  Gave them numerous chances.  Will not be returning or recommending this restaurant to anyone.  If you want good food at a decent price and your order made right every time, try Texas Roadhouse or even Fridays!

I think I have eaten at Red Robin for the last time. It used to be one our favorite treats. The quality of the burgers has dropped dramatically. They are tasteless, patties of grossness. I had a bacon avocado burger. Zero taste. Zero. Saddened by the decline (not exclusive to this location).

As a chain restaurant, you pretty much know what to expect when you walk in. I went in to this particular branch for a week day lunch and I was actually surprised how non-busy it was. The service was relatively quick, and our waiter was more than willing to oblige to a requested channel change of the TV in order for my boyfriend to be able to see the week day football highlights. If you're trying to grab a quick bite to eat on your lunch break, red robin is a great option. I love their freckled lemonade and bottomless fries!

Since its grand opening a few years ago, the Frederick Red Robin has been locked into a tug-of-war battle with the Germantown location for the title of "Shittiest Franchise in the Red Robin Chain." And while the Germantown joint is slightly ahead (based on my last miserable experience there), Frederick is fighting hard to reclaim its rightful crown. How will they do it, you ask? By continuing to serve up undercooked burgers, flavorless watered-down drinks and shakes, cold (recycled?) fries, and nonexistent service. And I think this may be their year! Admittedly, I'm a glutton for punishment. Despite repeated abuse at the hands of incompetent cooks, witless managers, and a team of indifferent waiters, I keep going back. I know, I hate myself for doing it, but it's my memories of a better Red Robin from long ago and far far away, one with fantastic food & friendly staff that have me trying again and again to relive the great time that Red Robin was meant to be. Alas, I'm in denial. I refuse to admit to myself that this restaurant is so poorly managed and so dreadfully staffed that it's incapable of delivering the goods; i.e. a pleasant dining experience. During my last ordeal an impatient waitress took our orders and then disappeared. She never came back. Nearly an hour later an overgrown teenager wearing a black shirt (a manager perhaps?) stopped by the table and offered us refills on our drinks (the first and only time that night), but no explanation regarding our missing waitress. Did she go home for the night without handing us off to another server? Was she ok? "Was the food ok?" "Can I get you folks anything else?" These questions were never asked or answered. To answer them... who knows, who cares, the burger was grossly undercooked, and I would have liked a refill on the fries. Not that any of it matters since later that night I was doubled-over on the toilet, shitting my brains out. They advertise bottomless fries, but fail to mention the complementary E. coli that comes with your entree. The Red Robin concept, when properly executed, is awesome. Finding one is damn near impossible.

Service was and is terrible. My son lives here and says it's always that way there. Took almost 2 hours to sit and eat with a 2 year old. When I asked why it took so long they blame the kitchen. Can't believe that when I watched all the tables around me fill and leave. Will not be back
Nice restaurant. ...great for kids. This red robin was great. Food came out on time and nothing was messed up. We will definitely return to this location with the family.

We went to red robbins for the first time. The service was bad. It took a long time to receive our food. It also took for ever for our server to pick up our payment. We ordered milk for our 2 years old and server forgot to deliver it. Our fork had discusting yellowish dirt on it. The food tasted good but the portion size was not good for the   son's food had a little piece of different food on it! We ordered spinach artichoke dip for appetizer.  The chips were soft and taste less.

The first time that we went to Red Robin for dinner we were completely disgusted by the lack of service and spoke with management about the issues and was given a coupon for a complimentary dinner (which we did not use). We had to go to the mall for some items and was extremely hungry and decided to give it another try (2 years later). We walked in and was seated promptly but when we received our silverware it was dirty so I asked for a replacement. Well needless to say the replacement silverware had lettuce on the knife and one of our plates was filthy as well. This time my husband actually talked to the manager and he said that he was sorry but they still have some "glitches" to work through. Seriously.... dirty utensils are glitches. Signed, NEVER to set foot back in there

ok so my initial review said this place is awesome..  and it's not anymore..  oh the food is good..  when it comes...  yer gonna wait for it tho.  service is a bit spotty now.  I'm wondering what happened here.  This used to be a great place to eat and now i'm finding myself going out of my way to avoid it.

Time of Visit:  May 21, 2015 at 11:45 am My Order:  Bleu Ribbon Burger                      Steak Fries                      Peach Iced Tea Total Rating = 3.9 (Four Stars) Red Robin is, of course, a large chain with many locations.  I visit this location often, as it is close and you can get a good meal.  I'll admit I made this trip because I'm a member of their Royalty Club and I had a free burger coming.  Because of that, I ordered a burger I had never tried before, the Bleu  Ribbon Burger.  Although the food didn't score exceptionally well, the non-food factors bump up the overall rating. Location and Access, Overall Rating 5 The place is real easy to find, just off I-270, right at the entrance to the Francis Scott Key Mall.  It's situated across the parking lot from Sears, so there is a LOT of parking available.  Great Access and parking, so it gets a 5. Facilities, Overall Rating 4 This building is only a few years old and was recently remodeled when the chain did a reimaging.  There is quite a bit of seating, but none outside, so you can't eat outside on a nice day.  Restrooms were adequately sized, clean, and easy to find.  Overall, a 4. Staff and Service, Overall Rating 5 I sat at the bar this trip, so I didn't have much interaction with the hostess, just enough to tell her I was going to the bar.  The bartender recognized me, as she had served me many times before.  As usual she was very friendly and responded quickly to my needs.  The menu has lots of options, including several non-burger entrees.  Even though they had to cook my burger to order, it still didn't take too long.  The service was excellent, a 5. Presentation, Overall Rating 4 The food comes out on a small platter, with the fries placed in a silver-colored cone/cylinder.  Very attractive, but not something that takes your breath away, a 4. Meat, Overall Rating 4 My burger was cooked just as I like it, cooked all the way through with no pink, yet there was still some juiciness to it.  Not dripping down your arms juicy, but not dry either.  It was char-grilled but didn't have an overwhelming charred flavor.  Very good in my opinion, a 4. Bun, Overall Rating 4 The standard bun option for this burger is an onion bun and I didn't change that.  It was a good, firm bun that held up well in the sandwich, but wasn't tough or dry.  It had a good flavor and went well with the burger, a 4. Toppings, Overall Rating 3.5 Bleu cheese:  The cheese had good texture and tasted really good.  Bleu cheese doesn't melt well over the burger, but just softened instead.  Because it was crumbles instead of a slice, the distribution across the burger wasn't even and some bites had a lot of cheese while others had only a little or none.  Pretty average for Bleu cheese, a 3. Steak sauce:  I can't say this did a lot for the burger, but it wasn't bad, a 3. Chipotle aioli:  I didn't really notice this and wouldn't have known it was on the burger, except for the slight heat it gave the sandwich.  But, again, it wasn't bad, a 3. Tomato slices:  This was just very average tomatoes, like you can get in any supermarket out of season, so they didn't add much flavor to the burger.  But since they did add a nice fresh juiciness that the sandwich needed, I'll give them a 4. Shredded lettuce:  I don't think shredded lettuce adds much to a burger, other than a few greens for your diet.  When the lettuce is shredded, you lose the crisp bite of a lettuce leaf.  It didn't detract from the burger, but sure didn't add anything either, a 3. Onion straws:  These were certainly the dominant topping on this burger.  They were crispy and held up well until the end, a 5. Balance/Taste, Overall Rating 3 The burger maintained its integrity all the way to the end, which I think was mainly due to the onion bun.  The standard bun Red Robin uses sometimes doesn't hold together, especially if moister toppings are used.  The onion straws dominated the flavor, although the bleu cheese bite did come out at times.  The bun was just a little too big for the patty.  While there was a little meat in each bite, in a few bites there was very little.  Good flavors, but the balance was a little off, so I'll give it a 3. Sides, Overall Rating 3.5 Steak Fries:  I'm not a big fan of steak fries, as they don't seem to get the crispiness I like.  Except for when they first came out, these fries quickly become soft.  You can have as many refills as you want, but I really only got a refill because I could, so only a 3. Peach iced tea:  This tea had a good peach flavor, and I wasn't overwhelmed with sweetness.  A good flavor and balance, but some might want it a little stronger, 4. Value, Overall Rating 3 Since I got this burger for free, it was a good value this time, but I don't think I would get this particular burger if I had to pay full price.  It costs a little more than most of their burgers and just doesn't warrant the extra cost, in my opinion.  I'll give it a 3.

I really don't like places like this...but I got some gift cards for Christmas, so I was not going to turn down a "free" meal.  This location is pretty new, it opened this past summer.  The inside is actually a lot smaller than one would imagine, and seating is really cramped.  That's one of my pet peeves.  I really, really like my personal bubble space. Anyway, the food was OK, pretty typical burger joint type food.  I don't eat hamburgers, so I opted for a seafood platter which was good, but basically just frozen boxed stuff.  Everyone else that was with me seemed to enjoy their food...but they're not as picky as me :)  I guess this is a good place for kids or teenagers, but I will not retur...

This review is purely on service not food quality. Food is great here, I love Red Robin. But the particular location is by the one of the slowest. The waitstaff is nice enough but they are so slow. I know it's not their fault - it's problem trickling down from the kitchen. But they need to check on waiting tables more often - offer fries, refill drinks. People wait forever here. I've been here when they are busy and when they are slow - it just just as long no matter what. Not sure what the problem is but it's definitely deterring me from this location.

The staff/managers weren't very friendly for starters (granted this is a new establishment).  They had trouble with our appetizer and the manager came by to explain the situation and ended up not charging us for our appetizer.  She was very nice about it, but she was also pre-occupied with the rest of her staff.  The place wasn't very busy, considering it was a Thursday so we didn't wait too long for our food (even though they messed up the appetizer order). Overall, the food was great and the experience wasn't too bad.  Not the best staff but then again, what can you expect for a Thursday afternoon?

Fast food dressed up in a sit down restaurant, but what's worse is the place is FILTHY!!!  Watched the bussers "clean a table" which involved clearing previous diners' dishes, cups, etc., run a filthy rag across the middle of the table, which pushed the crumbs onto the chairs, and that's it.  Clearly there was schmootz left on the table, added schmootz now on the chairs, and absolutely no attention paid to the already disgusting floor, which included an infant's toy which was soon going to be added to the piles of food and filth on the floor.  Patrons are crammed into dining spaces obviously designed to get as much profit from parents who are grateful to be able to drink alcohol while their children suck down greasy corndogs and fries. You leave smelling greasy and feeling bloated and disgusted from mediocre food (which evacuates from your body in less than an hour).

Terrible service, food, waitress, and manager.  Went to a late dinner on a Thursday night, hardley anyone there but needless to say it took over 45 minutes to get our food by another waitress. Food came out ice cold! Asked for a manager by this substitute waitress and instead get our original waitress....we asked for a manager again...waited another 10 minutes and no manager nor food nor waitress telling us what is going on. Ultimatley got up and found the manager at the bar hanging out with people at the bar...end result manager put the food order in and the waitress had a huge attitude bring us the replacement order.... Never, never, never again!! The head of Red Robin needs to come in the Frederick restaurant and rehire all new staff with some professionalism.

No stars for this place food cold buns stale and unless you are dating or married to the manger your service sucks. The mangers girlfriend had servers tripping over her while our server came back 15 minutes after the food was delivered and then we asked for more water she came back with one glass I am guessing for the 2 of us to share. Just hope someone at this place reads this and has the nerve to respond back

My fiancé and I love this place. We use to live near the White Marsh Mall, so would frequent the RR in the Mall about once every few months. Great burgers! I love the Tavern Double burgers (they are actually smaller than their normal burgers), and I usually get the Pig Out burger with bacon and bacon aioli. I get the jalapeno version when I'm feeling spicy. The beef is very good, as are the buns. The bottomless fries are delicious, but you can get a salad as a healthy option. I have gotten the ribs that come with mac and cheese and coleslaw--yummy comfort food! I am also a big fan of their cheap happy hour beers and margaritas! My favorite chain restaurant and I love the cheesy diner décor with nostalgic posters and plaques.

Way too loud and bad service.  The burgers come with "endless" fries... probably a good thing because the burgers were served with about 8 fries.  The food was served by a runner and we didn't see our waitress until our dinner was done and the water glasses were empty.   The food was good but the music was so loud it was ridiculous.

Love the burgers, service consistently bad.  Visited this location a number of times and there will be a line only to find half to 3/4 of the tables in the bar area were empty.  Took my son one time who was 20 and they would not let us sit in the bar area (at a table).  Then told me we could not get the bar happy hour specials outside of the bar area.  Done with this place.

Very kind service. My burger was messed up but the server kindly took it away and ordered a new one. The manager then brought out the new burger (with extra fries) and apologized. The food was very good. And we received the bill to find they had given me the burger for free. The service definitely made up for some mistakes with the food but I will definitely be back.

We were immediately ushered into the bar area to be seated at a table with high standing chairs. Problems with my back make it difficult to be seated in this situation, and when I asked to be seated at a booth instead, the response was somewhat frosty and cold from the hostess. Not the helpful and inviting response I expected. We were then left to be served by the bartender who was clearly too busy to provide any decent customer service to anyone. We sat with a view of the kitchen counter where the orders are placed for pick up. It was disappointing that our meals sat for nearly 10 minutes before the bartender could stop making drinks for other patrons and get our food. The food came to us warm not piping hot. During the course of our meal the bartender kept leaning over the bar asking us how our meal was. We felt somewhat disrespected as getting our attention from behind the bar and calling me "Buddy"  instead of coming  over to our table and providing service should have been. When I asked for the check the bartender told us that he would bring it right away. He obviously forgot. I had to take my credit card over to the bar to pay. While standing there waiting to have the bill processed another waiter asked "can I help you there Buddy?" Apparently "Buddy" is what they call all their male customers. I left there feeling like I paid for a sub-par meal with horrible customer service. We will not be back.
Love the fried zucchini strips! Get a double order and some ranch dressing and you'll be flyin high!

I went to the Red Robin in Frederick for the first time about a week ago with my boyfriend, and I loved it! The location is great, right across the street from the FSK mall and just off of the highway. The interior was nice and cozy, if not a little cramped, but everything was very modern and clean.  This is one of my boyfriend's favorite restaurants, and he convinced me to order the freckled strawberry lemonade...it was AMAZING. There are real strawberries mixed in and the whole drink is just mind-blowing, take my word for it. For $3.99 you get unlimited refills...and I took advantage of that by having 4 (including 1 to go!). Oops!  I ordered the bacon cheeseburger, and he ordered the Bonzai burger (a burger with pineapple). Both were really great, and they didn't fall apart like many burgers do. The beef was cooked perfectly too.  My only complaint was that the fries were kind of cold, and the burgers were a little pricey! Other than that, it is definitely a restaurant I will be back to again.

We've gone to several Red Robins in the DMV, it's one of our favorite places. This location is by far the worst we've dined at. The servers have absolutely no team effort and need to re-learn basic serving priorities. Your table should not still be waiting on a drink when they are more than half way through their appetizers. We were watching our beers sit at the bar. We even reminded the server that dropped off our appetizer and then when our waiter came by reminded him. Instead of taking less than two minutes to bring our drinks that had been waiting, he decided to go to the next table, take their dessert order and then continue to put it in the system. Several staff walked by without delivering let alone glancing over at the numerous drinks waiting to be delivered. I had to walk up to the bar when a manager walked over and asked him if I could deliver my own beers. The manager replied with, "Let me check that they're yours and I will bring them." Our server ended up delivering the drinks and of course no courtesy or apology. You would also think the manager would do a table touch to see why a customer tried to come to the bar to pick up their drinks. The waiter also never once even offered waters while we waited. After our meal he asked if we wanted anything and when we said no thank you he replied with, "Okay, good. I'll bring you your check."  We will not be back to this Red Robin again.

I went today. Great prices, great service. The food is usually good. I love their riblets, but today they just felt really dry. Manager came and delivered our food and made sure we were properly attended. Their drinks are not heavy, so you can always have a glass without worrying about getting liquored up.
they put me on hold 5 times and the music was horrible and they mad fun of my voice my kids started to cry

The food was decent, however the service was lacking. None of our empty plates or glasses were cleared off of the table during our visit. Several tables around us had never been cleared off and cleaned. However, employees were just standing around doing nothing. Not impressed.

OMG to the Max ~ I have waited for Frederick to get a RRB forever and folks today this place opens up.  The food is great and the staff (although new) is eager to serve you the best burgers in-town.  This place rocks, but be cautious they just opened today and they are new so they will make mistakes.  But let them get going and this will be Frederick HOT SPOT!

Love the burgers, but I don't like the way the restaurant is set up.  It's so crowded and tight. Most of the restaurant is set up so it's a big long couch seat stretched across the whole middle of the restaurant, with tables down the line that are put so close next to each other, and regular chairs on the other side of the table. There is absolutely no privacy. I was literally one foot between me and the old man next to me. I felt like I was eating with a group of 30 people and not a table of 2. It was so uncomfortable and I'm definitely not eating there unless its the middle of the day when it's not as crowded and I can get a private booth seat.

We were pleasantly surprised last night!  It had been well over a year since our last visit and what a difference.  Clearly new management as every aspect of the restaurant has changed.  Friendly, attentive staff and the kitchen was on its A game.  Food was delicious, hot and delicious.  Our server Bailey provided great service and kept our glasses full and was personable.  We'll be back.

If your going to be a good burger joint you have to hand patty your burgers it was fast service but highly disappointing when I got a very thin beef patty I got the burning love sandwich witch was tasty the beer is ice cold though

Picked up four burgers  to go on thursday night. I got the Bonsai Burger and it had pineapple (not enough) and bacon additionally (not enough). It was OK but far from remarkable. Portion of fries was small. Ruby Tuesday or Applebees can provide a better burger at a smaller price. I had previously eaten at this restaurant shortly after they opened with a similar impression - not particularly pleased but not particularly unhappy. For a place that is all about burgers they should be able to do better than this. I give it three stars for the fact that it's great to have a "burger joint" in town, but at $10 per burger plate and with Freez King and Beef N Bunz in Paradise in town at equal or better prices and with my Red Robin experience so far being lackluster, it sure isn't five star and four seems too generous. They serve beer, which is always welcome. As a side note, on my first visit to Red Robin there was a completely seran-wrapped car in the parking lot. I took out my cell phone and took a picture. The manager walked up to me and told me to erase the picture off of my phone. Really, he did. I just laughed it off and walked away from him. Not a big deal at all, I was just taken aback about it and how silly it was.

Had dinner at Red Robin tonight with my grandaughter. The food was delivered quickly and was very good. The only problem we had was the waitress brought us our check without asking if we wanted dessert. It kind of felt that we were being rushed out. I asked for the dessert menu and ordered. She took the check back and updated it. She seemed a bit surprised that we wanted dessert. I would think it would be to their benefit to "upsell" the dessert. Would have been a higher star rating except for that. Don't get me wrong, though. The waitress was nice & polite. I actually think it's a training issue.
The food was great. Cooked perfectly and the quality is apparent. Service was good. Their signature burger was 13 bucks

I have been to many other Red Robins, but today we went after church with 10 other people.  The wait was only 25 minutes which I thought that was pretty good considering the day/time/# of ppl.  The food was good, as I expected.  I really want to rave about the waitress.  She did an awesome job!  We have what can be a pretty rowdy group and she kept up with us really well!  We never waited for a refill, she was extremely friendly and incredibly accommodating to our request for multiple checks.  Great job Meghan D!!!
